body:
Hey! Thanks for reporting this. I am wondering if it might be the same issue someone else reported on the forum, which I am currently testing a fix for. Would you be able to test it and see if it solves your problem?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/test-saltysyncs/v1.70.0-beta.8570.2341934d8.test-saltysyncs/

Source: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/2341934d8ee396649745b266050f48b725a100de

> I understand that bisync is in beta and I'm happy to report that the feature is useful to me.

Glad to hear that ðŸ™‚

Thanks for the quick response! 
..but I got unrelated issues with my sftp setup so I'm in the process of migrating to the S3 api (minio) - if - as it seems - the fix is not related to sftp then I'll be able to test it but my config will definitly have changed. I'll keep you posted.

Thanks. The fix is not specific to sftp, but your particular issue could be... so if possible, it would be ideal to rule that out by first confirming that you can reproduce the issue with your new config, and if so, then testing whether the fix solves it.

I just finished migrating the backend and I'm now using S3/minio. I can confirm the modtime keeps acting up.
```
Access: 2025-02-04 19:50:07.236072574 -0500
Modify: 2025-02-03 10:15:06.000000000 -0500
Change: 2025-02-04 19:50:07.225072558 -0500
 Birth: 2025-02-03 12:35:08.819823780 -0500
```

As can be seen, that file got updated Today, but the modtime reverted to yesterday in the bisync process.
I should be able to test the fix. I'll be back
BTW, no conflict files Today, so its probably not related to conflict files.

rename.from: bisync: modtime of latest/updated file gets changed matching modtime of the previous revision when rclone conflict files are encountered
rename.to: bisync: modtime of latest/updated file gets changed matching modtime of the previous revision

body: Well, I'm not a termux dev. So I can not easily test on termux as any termux app it seems need specific patching and compiling. I've installed the beta on my linux boxes but I'm not clear if this will be conclusive. My initial observation was that the issue originated from a termux node and back propagated to the other nodes.

Update! We have a winner!
With the assumption from prior observations that the pb occured while pulling an update, and the fact that I could not update the termux nodes to 1.70 beta myself, I came up with that test :
So I disabled all but one of my termux nodes and initiated a change from that node. 
My termux nodes are running 1.69, my arm64/linux nodes are running v1.70.0-beta.8570.2341934d8.test-saltysyncs.
The update went as expected with the correct modtime on the linux nodes. 
Then I enabled another termux node running 1.69. and sure enough, the update occured, the modtime went backwards an propagated to the Linux nodes.

Please release 1.70 soon !!

@TheWhiteBug is there any chance you could do a `git bisect` to narrow down which change from v1.69.0 to the current beta fixes the problem? If we can work that out then we can put that in v1.69.1 which is due fairly soon.

@nielash wrote:
> [@TheWhiteBug](https://github.com/TheWhiteBug) is talking about this fix: [2341934](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/2341934d8ee396649745b266050f48b725a100de) which is on a dev branch, not `master`.
> 
> It is not quite ready for merging yet as it needs some cleanup and I also wanted to add a test (ironically, recreating this issue will be harder than fixing it!)

Ah, thanks for clearing that up. I'd like to make the point release some time before 15th Feb so if it is ready by then I'll stick it in v1.69.1

issue.title: bisync: fix listings missing concurrent modifications - fixes #8359

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Before this change, there was a bug affecting listing files when:

- a given bisync run had changes in the 2to1 direction
AND
- the run had NO changes in the 1to2 direction
AND
- at least one of the changed files changed AGAIN during the run (specifically, after the initial march and before the transfers.)

In this situation, the listings on one side would still retain the prior version of the changed file, potentially causing conflicts or errors. 

This change fixes the issue by making sure that if we're updating the listings on one side, we must also update the other. (We previously tried to skip it for efficiency, but this failed to account for the possibility that a changed file could change again during the run.)

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

- https://forum.rclone.org/t/avoiding-bisync-times-are-equal-conflicts-with-newer/46636/32?u=nielash
- #8359 

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: I've merged @nielash fix for this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.69.1 and v1.70.0
